intro: Psoralea nutans, commonly known as the drooping psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces trifoliate leaves, which are trifoliate in structure, and its flowers are typically pale yellow to brown in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The species is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
